poem.title: Vengeance is Mine
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Tirl the lock. Now pummel the door. There's a lull in the killing. This is war. Empty the till. Stop the push of the drawer With your pubis. Pocket the notes. House-to-house searches grundle and twirl, Crash through the living-room wall. Till the old town with an Abrams plow; Scatter contempt and it grows. Here are the dudes in their cavalry twill: The supply lines have finally caught up. Till later, we barter. Bombs are in dollars, buildings in blood. Warble and trill, little bird. In the garden Later, bury your voice.
